title: How to make a 45 Second Ice Cream | Jamie Oliver

comments.text:
i just tried this tonight and it came out great, and i'm not even sure I 
did it right.
I know what you're thinking, how can you screw up a recipe with 3 
ingredients?  well, my food processor isn't as large as Jamie's, so it took 
longer to mash up, the yogurt i had was kind of old, and the ratios weren't 
exact.  i could only get my hands on 450 grams of yogurt, but still used 
the 500g of strawberries.  i don't know if that matters much, but it was 
still amazing﻿

comments.author: jonathan hardy

comments.text:
This Is brilliant yum! But, that honey is VERY dark I thought it was maple 
syrup :) Anyhow, I have been on a homemade ice cream kick this winter. A 
few weeks ago I made strawberry cheesecake ice cream, it was to die for:) 
But, I had made a double batch, and my drum was cold enough to set one 
churning but not the second. Well being in Canada in the dead of winter, 
and, having just had a third major snow storm in one week, AND....... as it 
was midnight and 35°C below freezing with a bitter cold wind blowing....I 
decided to simply set my metal bowl with the cream mixture in it, in a snow 
bank and stir! It set up in like 2 minutes! No word of a lie, as we say 
here in the East! 
Well we still have those 150 cm snow banks but, the temps are moderating, 
the Canada geese are returning and the chickadees are starting to nest, so, 
in no time those snow banks will be gone and the daffodils will be up. In 
the meantime we await this year's maple syrup run:) Take care.﻿

comments.text:

Francisco, there were different types of Pimms by number .... Pimms No. 1, 
Pimms No. 2, Pimms No. 3, Pimms No. 4, and Pimms No. 5 We used to drink it 
on hot days with ice, soda, and a sprig of mint. Now, it is had to find. I 
suppose you could substitue rum or Cointreau?﻿
